intro: Alyssum caliacrae f. latirosulatum, commonly known as the broad-sulcate alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and ornamental plants. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and profuse display of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, with a distinctive broad, wavy margin that gives it its specific epithet. This plant is well adapted to dry environments, showing resilience to drought and high temperatures.
